briefTitle: An Exploratory Study of the Effect of Treatment Interruption on Safety of Exenatide in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.
* Have been exposed to exenatide for at least 3 months in previous Amylin/Lilly Studies H8O-MC-GWAO, H8O-MC-GWAP, H8O-MC-GWAT, or H8O-MC-GWBA.
* Have interrupted exenatide treatment for a period of at least 2 months.
* HbA1c of ≤10.5%.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry.
* Have previously completed or withdrawn from this study.
* Have taken marketed exenatide (Byetta) during the interim period between studies GWAO, GWAP, GWAT, or GWBA and the current study.
* Used drugs for weight loss (for example, Xenical® \[orlistat\], Meridia® \[sibutramine\], Acutrim® \[phenylpropanolamine\], Accomplia® \[rimonabant\], or similar over-the-counter medications) within 3 months of screening.
* Are currently treated with any of the following excluded medications: Drugs that directly affect gastrointestinal motility, including, but not limited to: Reglan® (metoclopramide), Propulsid® (cisapride), and chronic macrolide antibiotics.
* Use insulin with daily dosage exceeding 1 U/kg.

outcomeMeasures.title: Treatment-emergent Antibody Status (Maximum Titer Level Experienced)
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients who experienced specified treatment-emergent antibody status at any point during the study (grouped by maximum titer level experienced)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline to Endpoint
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline (Week 0) to endpoint (Week 24) by treatment-emergent antibody status

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Potentially Immune-related Treatment-emergent Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients experiencing a potentially immune-related treatment-emergent adverse event at any point during the study
